title: How To | Cover Dark Cirlces
description:
To cover dark circles caused by tired eyes, the first tip is to use a concealer that gets the job done. The Neutrogena HealthySkin Brightening Eye Perfector is a great go-to because of its lightweight liquid formula that makes it great for layering. 

Step 1: Start by applying concealer to the upper eye area in a backwards C formation. 

Step 2: Pat with ring finger. The heat from your finger will help blend the product seamlessly. 

Step 3: If you need more coverage, repeat this step until you see no more dark circles.

Follow our ‘How To’ series for more everyday makeup tips!

transcripts: When battling tired eyes, the first step is to use the concealer that gets the job done. My go to is the Neutrogena brightening eye perfector lightweight liquid formula which is key to layering. The key to covering dark circles is the backwards seed. Start by applying the concealer to the upper eye area with the brush provided. With a padding motion, blend the concealer with your ring finger. The heat from your finger will help blend the product seamlessly. If you need more coverage, repeat this step until you see no more dark circles. Your very own photo editing tool. No filter needed.
